era.英释: a period of time in history that is known for a particular event, or for particular qualities

hit.中释: (唱片、电影或戏剧的) 成功；命中，击中
hit.英释: something such as a film, play, song etc that is very popular and successful

via.英释: travelling through a place on the way to another place

lap.英释: the upper part of your legs when you are sitting down

bow.英释: to bend the top part of your body forward in order to show respect for someone important, or as a way of thanking an  audience

pop.英释: to come suddenly or unexpectedly out of or away from something

gum.英释: your gums are the two areas of firm pink flesh at the top and bottom of your mouth, in which your teeth are fixed

bid.英释: to offer to pay a particular price for goods, especially in an auction

ban.英释: to say that something must not be done, seen, used etc

gym.英释: a special building or room that has equipment for doing physical exercise

gap.英释: a space between two objects or two parts of an object, especially because something is missing

due.英释: expected to happen or arrive at a particular time

hub.英释: the central and most important part of an area, system, activity etc, which all the other parts are connected to

pad.英释: If you pad something, you put something soft in it or over it in order to make it less hard, to protect it, or to give it a different shape

pat.英释: a friendly act of touching someone with your hand flat

paw.英释: an animal’s foot that has nails or  claw s

pea.英释: a round green seed that is cooked and eaten as a vegetable, or the plant on which these seeds grow

pit.英释: to put small marks or holes in the surface of something

cue.英释: to give someone a sign that it is the right moment for them to speak or do something, especially during a performance

lid.英释: a cover for the open part of a pot, box, or other container

hay.英释: long grass that has been cut and dried, used as food for cattle

log.英释: to make an official record of events, facts etc

hip.英释: one of the two parts on each side of your body between the top of your leg and your waist

dam.英释: to stop the water in a river or stream from flowing by building a special wall across it

dim.英释: if a light dims, or if you dim it, it becomes less bright

hut.英释: a small simple building with only one or two rooms

mat.英释: a small piece of thick rough material which covers part of a floor

dye.英释: a substance you use to change the colour of your clothes, hair etc

van.英释: a vehicle used especially for carrying goods, which is smaller than a truck and has a roof and usually no windows at the sides

mud.英释: wet earth that has become soft and sticky

mug.英释: to attack someone and rob them in a public place

inn.英释: a small hotel or pub, especially an old one in the countryside

rag.中释: 破布， 碎布； 破旧衣服
rag.英释: a small piece of old cloth, for example one used for cleaning things

rat.英释: an animal that looks like a large mouse with a long tail

raw.中释: 自然状态的， 未加工过的； 生的； 未经分析的， 原始的； 生疏无知的， 未经训练的； 露肉而刺痛的

rib.英释: one of the 12 pairs of curved bones that surround your chest

rid.中释: 使摆脱， 解除…的负担， 从…中清除
rid.英释: If you rid a place or person of something undesirable or unwanted, you succeed in removing it completely from that place or person

aid.中释: 帮助； 救护； 助手； 辅助手段
aid.英释: help that you need to do a particular thing

rob.英释: to steal money or property from a person, bank etc

rod.英释: a long thin pole or bar

eve.中释: 前夜， 前夕， 前一刻
eve.英释: the night or day before an important day

jar.英释: a glass container with a wide top and a lid, used for storing food such as jam or honey, or the amount it contains

jaw.英释: one of the two bones that your teeth are in

ash.英释: the soft grey powder that remains after something has been burned

rub.英释: to move your hand, or something such as a cloth, backwards and forwards over a surface while pressing firmly

rug.英释: a piece of thick cloth or wool that covers part of a floor, used for warmth or as a decoration

jet.英释: a fast plane with a jet engine

wax.英释: to rub a layer of wax into a floor, surface etc to protect it or make it shine

fee.英释: an amount of money that you pay to do something or that you pay to a professional person for their work

wit.中释: 风趣； 妙语； 智力， 才智， 智能
wit.英释: the ability to say things that are clever and amusing

bat.中释: 蝙蝠； 球棒， 球拍
bat.英释: a small animal like a mouse with wings that flies around at night

bay.英释: A bay is a part of a coast where the land curves inward

sew.英释: to use a needle and thread to make or repair clothes or to fasten something such as a button to them

bet.中释: 打赌； 赌金， 赌注
bet.英释: an agreement to risk money on the result of a race, game etc or on something happening, or the money that you risk

fog.英释: cloudy air near the ground which is difficult to see through

sin.英释: an action that is against religious rules and is considered to be an offence against God

fry.中释: 油煎， 油炸， 油炒
fry.英释: to cook something in hot fat or oil, or to be cooked in hot fat or oil

odd.中释: 奇特的； 临时的； 奇数的； 单只的； 剩余的， 挂零的
odd.英释: different from what is normal or expected, especially in a way that you disapprove of or cannot understand

fur.中释: 软毛， 毛皮， 裘皮； 毛皮衣服
fur.英释: the thick soft hair that covers the bodies of some animals, such as cats, dogs, and rabbits

sow.英释: to plant or scatter seeds on a piece of ground

ore.英释: rock or earth from which metal can be obtained

owe.中释: 欠； 应把…归功于； 感激， 感恩
owe.英释: to be successful because of the good effect or influence of something or someone

tag.英释: to attach a tag to something

tax.中释: 对…征税； 使负担重， 使费尽力气
tax.英释: to charge a tax on something

hat.英释: a piece of clothing that you wear on your head

put.英释: to move something to a particular place or position, especially using your hands

nor.英释: used when mentioning two things that are not true or do not happen

net.英释: something used for catching fish, insects, or animals which is made of threads or wires woven across each other with regular spaces between them

get.中释: 获得，得到；到达；变成，成为
get.英释: to obtain something by finding it, asking for it, or paying for it

cow.英释: a large female animal that is kept on farms and used to produce milk or meat

fun.英释: an experience or activity that is very enjoyable and exciting

may.英释: if something may happen or may be true, there is a possibility that it will happen or be true but this is not certain

dew.英释: the small drops of water that form on outdoor surfaces during the night

new.英释: recently made, built, invented, written, designed etc

can.英释: a metal container in which food or drink is preserved without air

toe.英释: one of the five movable parts at the end of your foot

ago.英释: used to show how far back in the past something happened

pen.英释: an instrument for writing or drawing with ink

bud.英释: a young tightly rolled-up flower or leaf before it opens

tap.英释: to hit your fingers lightly on something, for example to get someone’s attention

arm.英释: one of the two long parts of your body between your shoulders and your hands

lip.英释: one of the two soft parts around your mouth where your skin is redder or darker

her.英释: belonging to or connected with a woman, girl, or female animal that has already been mentioned

bed.英释: a piece of furniture that you sleep on

fox.英释: a wild animal like a dog with reddish-brown fur, a pointed face, and a thick tail

oil.英释: to put oil onto part of a machine or part of something that moves, to help it to move or work more smoothly

ask.英释: to speak or write to someone in order to get an answer, information, or a solution

pin.英释: to fasten something somewhere, or to join two things together, using a pin

saw.英释: to cut something using a saw

for.英释: used to say who is intended to get or use something, or where something is intended to be used

fan.英释: someone who likes a particular sport or performing art very much, or who admires a famous person

nut.英释: a dry brown fruit inside a hard shell, that grows on a tree

gun.英释: a metal weapon which shoots bullets or shells

but.英释: used to connect two statements or phrases when the second one adds something different or seems surprising after the first one

big.英释: of more than average size or amount

nod.英释: to move your head up and down, especially in order to show agreement or understanding

one.英释: used to refer to a member of a group or pair of people or things

pie.英释: fruit baked inside a  pastry  covering

die.英释: to stop living and become dead

job.英释: the regular paid work that you do for an employer

owl.英释: a bird with large eyes that hunts at night

cry.英释: to produce tears from your eyes, usually because you are unhappy or hurt

bag.英释: the amount that a bag will hold

leg.英释: one of the long parts of your body that your feet are joined to, or a similar part on an animal or insect

map.英释: a drawing of a particular area, for example a city or country, which shows its main features, such as its roads, rivers, mountains etc

law.英释: the whole system of rules that people in a particular country or area must obey

ant.英释: a small insect that lives in large groups

say.英释: used when suggesting or supposing that something might happen or be true

key.英释: a small specially shaped piece of metal that you put into a lock and turn in order to lock or unlock a door, start a car etc

pan.英释: a round metal container that you use for cooking, usually with one long handle and a lid

him.英释: used to refer to a man, boy, or male animal that has already been mentioned or is already known about

cat.英释: a small animal with four legs that people often keep as a pet

cut.英释: to divide something or separate something from its main part, using scissors, a knife etc

oar.英释: a long pole with a wide flat blade at one end, used for rowing a boat

bar.英释: one of the rooms inside a pub

fly.英释: if a plane, spacecraft etc flies, it moves through the air

any.英释: some or even the smallest amount or number

dry.英释: without water or liquid inside or on the surface

beg.英释: to ask for something in an anxious or urgent way, because you want it very much

bee.英释: a black and yellow flying insect that makes  honey  and can sting you

fit.英释: to be the right shape and size for sb/sth

lay.英释: to put sb/sth in a particular position, especially when it is done gently or carefully

car.英释: a vehicle with four wheels and an engine, that can carry a small number of passengers

row.英释: a line of things or people next to each other

dig.英释: to move earth, snow etc, or to make a hole in the ground, using a spade or your hands

aim.英释: to point or direct a weapon, a shot, a kick, etc. at sb/sth

its.英释: used to refer to something that belongs to or is connected with a thing, animal, baby etc that has already been mentioned

how.英释: used to ask or talk about the way in which something happens or is done

air.英释: the mixture of gases around the Earth, that we breathe

age.英释: to start looking older or to make someone or something look older

egg.英释: a round object with a hard surface, that contains a baby bird, snake, insect etc and which is produced by a female bird, snake, insect etc

all.英释: the whole of a particular group or thing or to everyone or everything of a particular kind

gas.英释: a substance such as air, which is not solid or liquid, and usually cannot be seen

tin.英释: a soft silver-white metal that is often used to cover and protect iron and steel. It is a chemical element: symbol Sn

mix.英释: if you mix two or more substances or if they mix, they combine to become a single substance, and they cannot be easily separated

cup.英释: a small round container, usually with a handle, that you use to drink tea, coffee etc

pig.英释: a farm animal with short legs, a fat body and a curved tail. Pigs are kept for their meat, which includes  pork  ,  bacon  and  ham  .

art.英释: the use of painting, drawing,  sculpture  etc to represent things or express ideas

buy.英释: to get something by paying money for it

fix.英释: to decide on a limit for something, especially prices, costs etc, so that they do not change

out.英释: from inside an object, container, building, or place

ice.英释: to cover an injured part of the body in ice to stop it from swelling

our.英释: belonging to or connected with us

box.英释: a container for putting things in, especially one with four stiff straight sides

lie.英释: to be or put yourself in a flat or horizontal position so that you are not standing or sitting

boy.英释: a male child, or a male person in general

eat.英释: to put food in your mouth and chew and swallow it

add.英释: to put something with something else or with a group of other things

end.英释: to finish; to make sth finish

flu.英释: a common illness that makes you feel very tired and weak, gives you a sore throat, and makes you cough and have to clear your nose a lot

eye.英释: one of the two parts of the body that you use to see with

own.英释: to have something which belongs to you, especially because you have bought it, been given it etc and it is legally yours

oak.英释: a large tree that is common in northern countries, or the hard wood of this tree

ink.英释: a coloured liquid that you use for writing, printing or drawing

dog.英释: a common animal with four legs, fur, and a tail. Dogs are kept as pets or trained to guard places, find drugs etc.

few.英释: not many or hardly any people or things

and.英释: used to join two words, phrases etc referring to things that are related in some way

hot.英释: something that is hot has a high temperature - used about weather, places, food, drink, or objects

old.英释: someone who is old has lived for a very long time

jam.英释: a thick sweet substance made from boiled fruit and sugar, eaten especially on bread

pot.英释: a deep round container used for cooking things in

God.英释: (in some religions) a being or spirit who is believed to have power over a particular part of nature or who is believed to represent a particular quality

ill.英释: badly or in an unpleasant way

cap.英释: a covering that fits very closely to your head

pay.英释: to give someone money for something you buy or for a service

nap.英释: a short sleep, especially during the day

bus.英释: a large vehicle that people pay to travel on

pet.英释: an animal such as a cat or a dog which you keep and care for at home

ear.英释: one of the organs on either side of your head that you hear with

let.英释: to allow someone to do something

ray.英释: a straight narrow beam of light from the sun or moon

not.英释: used to make a word, statement, or question negative
